title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish and operate managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. These plans can be operated through Department health-care facilities and may involve partnerships with other public or private entities. The plans must adhere to standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary may establish managed health care plans for veterans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. These plans must meet standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Minimum health care benefits, including those covered under Medicare, will be provided to enrolled veterans. An enrollment system may be established for veterans not covered under specific sections. Cost-sharing requirements for veterans enrolled in the plan may be determined by the Secretary. The Secretary may establish cost-sharing requirements for veterans enrolled in a health-care plan to cover costs not paid by Medicare. Payments received for care provided to veterans in the plan will be used to cover the costs of care. The Secretary is prohibited from operating a plan in any fiscal year. Payments received for care provided to veterans in the plan will be used to cover the costs of care. The Secretary is prohibited from operating a plan in any fiscal year unless sufficient funds are allotted to the facility. Establishment of managed health-care plans with a requirement for payment for certain services provided by Department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. This includes veterans who are Medicare-eligible individuals and not described in section 1710(a)(1) of the title. The payments are made under similar terms as payments to other eligible managed care health plans under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. These plans, organized under section 1705, providing care to Medicare-eligible veterans, are deemed certified Medicare Choice organizations. The Secretary certifies compliant plans annually to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The term 'Medicare program' refers to the health insurance program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. The terms 'Medicare program', 'Medicare-eligible veteran', and 'Medicare Choice organization' are defined in this section. Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for certain veterans, effective after the enactment of this Act.
